nav.div: Victor Valley Union High School District » News » What's New » CLOSURE RESOURCES

div.div: Resources and information for the COVID-19 closure

div.img:
This is a collection of various resources and informative articles for parents, guardians and the community during our extended closure due to COVID-19.
A list of local resources for families, including food and other supports, compiled by district staff (in English and Spanish):
Family Resources.pdf
Recursos Familiares.pdf
Guidance for parents and caregivers during the extended closure, compiled by VVUHSD staff (in English and Spanish):
For Parents and Caregivers During School Closures.pdf
For Parents and Caregivers During School Closures - Spanish.pdf
An article by VVUHSD counselor Carrie Bershee about supporting children during this difficult time:
https://carriebershee.com/2020/03/17/supporting-kids-emotionally-at-this-critical-time-in-their-childhoods/
COVID-19 fact sheet and tips for stopping the spread of the virus from the Centers for Disease Control:
2019-ncov-factsheet.pdf
stop-the-spread-of-germs.pdf
Guidance on how to talk to children about COVID-19 from the National Association of School Psychologists and the National Association of School Nurses, in English and Spanish:
COVID-19_parent_handout_NASP_NASN_2-20.pdf
Spanish_COVID-19_parent_handout_NASP_NASN_2-20_FINAL.pdf
Guidance on coping with stress during infections disease outbreaks from the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration:
coping with stress during infectious disease outbreaks.pdf
Tips on coping with stress for adults and children from the World Health Organization:
coping-with-stress.pdf
helping-children-cope-with-stress-print.pdf
Building developmental relationships during the crisis, from the Search Institute:
Coronavirus-checklist-Search-Institute.pdf
Guidance from the American Academy of Pediatrics (various resources):
https://www.healthychildren.org/English/Pages/default.aspx
"How to Avoid Passing Anxiety on to Your Kids":
https://childmind.org/article/how-to-avoid-passing-anxiety-on-to-your-kids/
VVUHSD Resources - TechEd Resources for Families, Students and Teachers. Includes directions for curriculum access, google classroom, and more!
https://sites.google.com/vvuhsd.org/vvuhsd-resources/tech-resources

div.h3: Victor Valley Union High School District
div.div: 16350 Mojave Drive, Victorville, CA 92395 | Phone (760) 955-3201 | Fax (760) 245-4634
